Plot genomic elements from regulonDB

Source: R/get_dna_objects.R
get_dna_objects.Rd

Plot genomic elements from regulonDB

get_dna_objects(
  regulondb,
  genome = "eschColi_K12",
  from = 0,
  to = 4641628,
  elements = "gene"
)

Arguments

regulondb

A regulondb() object.
genome

A valid UCSC genome name.
from

A integer(1) specifying the left position.
to

A integer(1) specifying the right position.
elements

A character vector specifying which annotation elements to plot. It can be any from: "-10 promoter box", "-35 promoter box", "gene", "promoter", "Regulatory Interaction", "sRNA interaction", or "terminator".

Value

GenomicRanges::GRanges-class() object with the elements found.

Examples

## Connect to the RegulonDB database if necessary
if(!exists('regulondb_conn')) regulondb_conn <- connect_database()
#> snapshotDate(): 2020-02-12
#> regulondb_sqlite3_v10.6.2_DM.db already exists in local directory, setoverwrite = TRUE if you want to replace the existing file.

## Build the regulondb object
e_coli_regulondb <-
    regulondb(
        database_conn = regulondb_conn,
        organism = "chr",
        database_version = "1",
        genome_version = "1"
    )

## Get all genes from E. coli
get_dna_objects(e_coli_regulondb)
#> GRanges object with 4583 ranges and 4 metadata columns:
#>          seqnames          ranges strand |           id        type        name
#>             <Rle>       <IRanges>  <Rle> |  <character> <character> <character>
#>      [1]      chr 4265782-4266861      + | ECK120000001        gene         alr
#>      [2]      chr   795862-796551      + | ECK120000002        gene        modB
#>      [3]      chr 2531463-2532224      + | ECK120000003        gene        cysZ
#>      [4]      chr 3812731-3813951      + | ECK120000004        gene         dfp
#>      [5]      chr 4347404-4348744      - | ECK120000005        gene        dcuB
#>      ...      ...             ...    ... .          ...         ...         ...
#>   [4579]      chr 3032939-3033010      - | ECK125276531        gene        yqfH
#>   [4580]      chr   850332-850397      + | ECK125276532        gene        yliM
#>   [4581]      chr 1642122-1642211      + | ECK125276533        gene        ynfS

## Get genes providing Genomic Ranges
get_dna_objects(e_coli_regulondb, from = 5000, to = 10000)
#> GRanges object with 6 ranges and 4 metadata columns:
#>       seqnames    ranges strand |           id        type        name
#>          <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> |  <character> <character> <character>
#>   [1]      chr 5683-6459      - | ECK120000009        gene        yaaA
#>   [2]      chr 3734-5020      + | ECK120000989        gene        thrC
#>   [3]      chr 9306-9893      + | ECK120001467        gene         mog
#>   [4]      chr 6529-7959      - | ECK120001508        gene        yaaJ
#>   [5]      chr 8238-9191      + | ECK120001509        gene        talB
#>   [6]      chr 5234-5530      + | ECK120002701        gene        yaaX
#>                                   description
#>                                   <character>
#>   [1] peroxide stress resistance protein YaaA
#>   [2]                      threonine synthase
#>   [3]       molybdopterin adenylyltransferase
#>   [4]               putative transporter YaaJ
#>   [5]                         transaldolase B
#>   [6]  DUF2502 domain-containing protein YaaX
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths

## Get aditional elements within genomic positions
get_dna_objects(e_coli_regulondb, from = 5000, to = 10000, elements = c("gene", "promoter"))
#> GRanges object with 19 ranges and 4 metadata columns:
